snippet.title: She Could Fly: Documentary Escape Game Trailer
snippet.description:
Online gamer Tiger Orchid has picked up the new title 'She Could Fly: Documentary Escape Game'. You play with Tiger entering an empty flat covered in comic book art. Who lives here? What's up with the creepy knitted birds? How do you get out? Will someone fix the toaster? 

She Could Fly: Documentary Escape Game is a point and click game with looping levels, which features comics, documentaries and gaming to explore OCD and anxiety. 

Wishlist on STEAM: https://store.steampowered.com/app/2679650/She_Could_Fly_Documentary_Escape_Game/

BACKGROUND
Inspired by the acclaimed comic book SHE COULD FLY written by Christopher Cantwell (Halt and Catch Fire, Iron Man, Dr Doom) who lives with OCD and illustrated by Martín Morazzo (Ice Cream Man) the game features artwork from the comic, which is published by Berger Books (Dark Horse), helmed by the legendary comic editor Karen Berger (Vertigo/DC).

The creative team have collaborated with scientists, OCD Action and people with lived experience of OCD to inform the game design and create a global engagement campaign to shift how we think about OCD and mental health.

This game is produced by Wowbagger Productions in association with Two Tails Studios and Oubliette Escapes. The project is funded by Academy of Medical Sciences, Arts Council England, Joseph Rowntree Foundation, Physiological Society and UK Games Fund.

The game is 'not-for-profit' with all funds going to support development of the game and engagement around OCD & mental health.
